benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Scenarios TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05 cover successful creation with single/multiple tags and basic success paths.
Invalid Payload: TC09 (malformed JSON) and TC12 (extra/unsupported parameters) cover input validation and error handling for bad payloads.
Missing/Invalid Headers: TC06 covers missing required header (400).
Non-existent/Bad IDs: TC07 (invalid invoice item id format) and TC08 (non-existent invoice item) cover invalid resource handling.
Security/Malformed/Edge Input: TC18 (malicious payload) and TC25 (timeout) address security and timeout edge cases.
Duplicate Handling: TC13 covers duplicate tag definitions in request; TC20 covers regression for existing tag.
Dependency/Service State: TC17 (service unavailable) and TC21 (dependent tag service unavailable) test resilience to downstream failures.
State Variations: TC22 (partially populated DB) and TC23 (max tags scenario) test state-related boundaries.
Large/Complex Payloads: TC19 (very large payload) explores large input handling.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior when listing or managing large sets of tags or items.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios checking caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache validation.
Rate Limiting: No tests for rate limiting or throttling behavior under burst requests.
Partial/Null Elements: While TC24 tests null/empty elements in the payload, broader validation for mixed valid/invalid arrays could be expanded.
Concurrency/Race Conditions: No explicit tests for concurrent adds to the same item (beyond the basic state variations).
recommendations: Add pagination-focused tests for listing/handling large tag sets with the POST operation in scenarios where responses paginate, including proper 200/201 responses and pagination metadata.
Add caching tests to verify ETag/Cache-Control headers on POST responses when applicable.
Add rate-limiting/throttling scenarios to ensure the system gracefully handles bursts of POST requests.
Enhance null/mixed-input validation tests to cover arrays with a mix of null, empty, and valid UUIDs in more complex combinations.
Introduce explicit concurrency/race-condition tests for simultaneous posts to the same invoice item to validate idempotency and proper merge behavior.
